example.eg: I have three twenty-dollar bills.
example.egtrans: 我有三张二十美元的钞票。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 纸币, 钞票, 现钞

example.eg: I received the electricity bill in the mail yesterday.
example.egtrans: 昨天我收到了邮寄过来的电费账单。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 账单, 清单, 发票

example.eg: Waiter, could you please bring me the bill?
example.egtrans: 服务员，能请你把账单拿给我吗？

example.eg: They will bill you later.
example.egtrans: 他们稍后会要求你支付。

example.eg: I can't believe the hospital billed me ten thousand dollars.
example.egtrans: 我不敢相信医院给我开了10000美元的账单。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 给某人开某物的账单, 要求某人为某物付账

example.eg: The lawyer billed him three hundred dollars for the service.
example.egtrans: 那名律师向他收取300美元的服务费。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 要求某人为某事付...（钱）, 向某人收取...（钱）的...费用

example.eg: The bill of charges and expenses itemized all project spending.
example.egtrans: 项目成本均按收费票据和开支逐项列出了。

example.eg: The circus posted bills announcing its arrival in the town.
example.egtrans: 马戏团在镇上贴满海报，好让居民知道。

example.eg: The Bill was approved by Congress and is going before the President.
example.egtrans: 该议案已得到国会批准，正在呈交总统审批。

example.eg: The bill states that there are two showings of the film today.
example.egtrans: 影院的海报上说今天有两场电影。

trans_examp.trans_cn: （影院的）海报, 节目单, 上映场次安排表

example.eg: The duck caught a fish in its bill.
example.egtrans: 鸭子的嘴里衔了一条鱼。

example.eg: Two angry-looking guards holding bills stood next to the gate.
example.egtrans: 两个凶神恶煞的守卫手持钩镰枪站在大门旁。

example.eg: Bob wore a baseball cap with a frayed bill.
example.egtrans: 鲍勃头戴一顶帽舌被磨破的棒球帽。

example.eg: The band was billed as the next Beatles.
The teller counted out the banknotes and handed them to me.
The exporter sent a bill of exchange for the value of the goods.
The bill of fare at the hotel was pretty poor.
So, what's the bill of fare at this conference?
The bill of lading listed all the contents of the shipment.
example.egtrans: 这张提单上列出了货物的全部内容。

example.eg: The general idea of the "taxpayers' bill of rights" seems to be that taxes are evil.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 工程量清单, 人权条例

example.eg: The dealership gave me a bill of sale when I bought a car.
The doctor has given me a clean bill of health.
It's good to see the building project has a clean bill of health.
There was a pile of dollar bills on the table.
I can't remember the last time I saw a double bill at a cinema.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 连场电影, 双场电影

dsense.name: fit the bill, fill the bill

trans_examp.trans_cn: 刚好符合要求, 正好满足需要

example.eg: I paid for my lunch with a five-dollar bill.
The Insurance company refused my claim, so I had to foot the bill for repairs myself.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 付帐, 负担费用, 买单

example.eg: Jake had trouble spending his hundred-dollar bill, since none of the cashiers would give him change for it.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 百元钞票, 百元大钞

example.eg: When you check out of a hotel they usually give you an itemised bill.
His hospital stay was short, but the medical bill was very long.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 医疗帐单，医疗费用，医疗费

example.eg: There was a mountain of past-due bills on the desk.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 过期票据, 过期帐单

example.eg: I asked the waiter if I could pay the bill.
When I was a child, I always got a brand new ten-dollar bill for my birthday.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 十元美钞, 十元钞票

example.eg: Wow, would you look at that, I just found a twenty-dollar bill on the ground!

trans_examp.trans_cn: 二十美元的钞票, 二十美元的纸币
